page.title: 16Louth Markets
page.content: Louth grew up as a market town and the market is still an important feature of the community.There are two markets indoor and outdoor,which are open from about 9am to 4pm on Wednesday,Friday and Saturday.The Market Hall was opened on the 1st of August 1886.The outdoor market is in the Cornmarket and Market Place,where as the indoor is in the Market Hall. The Market holders pay between Â£5 and Â£10 for their stalls and regularly visit other markets in the area such as Mablethorpe and Horncastle. The town also has a Cattle Market situated on Newmarket.It operates on Fridays.It consists of five sections for cattle,pigs,calves,storebeast and sheep.The price for a pig can range from Â£20 to Â£150.A sheep costs Â£45 to Â£60 and a bull Â£800 to Â£3000.Dairy cows cost between Â£600 to Â£2000.
